description: Daria Tomenko uploads the 'Transparency Patch' after a tense debate with her team, pushing the Council to approve releasing edited BCI source codes and leadership meeting footage.
Council launches the 'Transparency Protocol,' broadcasting select BCI code segments and council sessions. Citizens welcome the move but quickly notice inconsistencies and heavy redactions.
Citizen auditors expose gaps in the 'Transparency Protocol.' Online forums fill with comparative analysis, proving much of the shared data is incomplete or manipulated.
Rumors spread that Council decisions are made in private. Activist networks organize coordinated, low-level acts of noncompliance to test the system’s weaknesses.
Minor disruptions and passive resistance grow citywide, weakening BCI’s predictive grip. Citizens increasingly disregard minor rules in everyday life, eroding system authority.
